summary:
Mesothelioma is a rare cancer that affects the tissue around your organs, especially in your lungs. It can cause breathing problems, chest pain, and weight loss. The main cause is breathing in asbestos dust, which can take 40 years to show symptoms. 

Doctors use X-rays and scans to diagnose it, and treatment includes surgery, chemo, and radiation. It's more common in older people, especially men, and is rare in Japan but higher in Australia and the UK.
title: Mesothelioma
